## Q1: Plot \\(h(x) \\; for \\; x \\in \[0,1\]\\).

Considering the function \$\$h(x) = \\big\[\\cos(4x)+\\tan(0.5x)\\big\]\^4\$\$

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| include: true
#| message: false
#| warning: false
library(ggplot2)
myFunction <- function(x) {
  y <- (cos(4 * x) + tan(0.5 * x))^4
  return(y)
}
ggplot() +
  stat_function(
    fun = myFunction,
    xlim = c(0, 1),
    n = 1000
  ) +
  theme_bw() +
  labs(
    x = "x",
    y = "h(x)"
  )

```

# Q2: Diamonds Plot

```{r}
#| echo: true
#| include: true
#| message: false
#| warning: false
data(diamonds)
ggplot(diamonds, aes(x = carat, y = price, color = clarity)) +
  geom_point(alpha = 0.5, size = 1.5) +
  labs(
    title = "Relationship Between Diamond Carat and Price",
    subtitle = "Colored by Clarity Level",
    x = "Carat (Weight)",
    y = "Price (USD)",
    color = "Clarity"
  ) +
  scale_color_brewer(palette = "Dark2") +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 14) +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(face = "bold", hjust = 0.5),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(hjust = 0.5),
    legend.position = "right",
    legend.title = element_text(face = "bold")
  )
```

a\. Finding Average Price for 2007.

```{r, error = TRUE}
#| echo: true
#| include: true
#| message: false
#| warning: false
avg_2007 <- tortilla_data %>%
  filter(year == 2007) %>%
  summarise(avg_price = mean(price, na.rm = TRUE))

cat("The average price of tortillas in 2007 was:", round(avg_2007$avg_price, 2), "pesos\n")
```
